lenders.occupational_info:
Hope for HIV/AIDS recognizes that the battle against HIV/AIDS, Malaria and Poverty can be won at the community level where the issues practices hold sway. To this effect, the organization creates a platform for linking various communities in fighting these scourges through the following strategies:

o H.E.L.P- HIV/AIDS Enlightenment and Life Program, is our educative channel that we use to create adequate awareness an HIV via workshops, Seminars and talks at varying levels.
o HOME-BASED CARE- This is holistic home visit activities in which we reachout to the poor identify and establish relationship with them.
o o HOPE CORPS: Volunteer who provides Home-based Care to PLWHA.

lenders.name: Kato
lenders.occupational_info:
I was diagnosed with feline hyperthyroidism in late September 2011.  Taking pills twice a day was no fun (for me or my owner) which is why we had to find an alternative treatment.  I was sent to a clinic for Radioiodine I-131 Therapy in mid-October and will find out in January if I have been cured.
UPDATE 2012:  My blood tests in January 2012 show that I no longer have hyperthyroidism.   UPDATE 2013: My beautiful, black cat was diagnosed with soft tissue cancer in early May and had to be put to sleep on May 10, 2013.  I miss my 'mini-panther'.  He was a large part of my life! (Alexandra9167)

lenders.occupational_info: I do everything I can to insure the health of the Great Lakes ecosystem for generations to come. I educate people about the Great Lakes and try to instill a sense that we as a global community need to recognize that actively or passively, we are currently making important choices about the future of water as a resource on our planet. I push for active, educated decision making.

lenders.name: Serik
lenders.loan_because:
I am promoting a new amateur soccer club, Almaty United Football Club (www.clubwebsite.co.uk/almatyunitedfootballclub ,  www.yourfootballclub.org)
You can become one of the owners of the Almaty United  Football Club, Kazakstan (UEFA member since 2002), just for £1!  
       You will be able to vote on strategic issues, check financial statement of the club, your name (or nickname) will be listed in Club's Owner List. You will get a discount on club items and you will have the priority rights in club issues.  
      This year Almaty United starts in Division Two, Almaty City B-League. Champion  of  City  B-League is promoted to Almaty City A-League  -  this   is   current   objective  of  "Almaty United".    Winner  of  Almaty City A-League plays in Division Two play-offs and two finalist teams get promotion to Division One. Teams of Division One are allowed to play in Kazakstan Cup so in three years from now Almaty United could reach UEFA Cup if we win Kazakstan Cup! And finally, two top teams of Division One are promoted to Kazakstani Premiership. Winner of Premiership participates in Champions League (usually in 1st qualification round). Thus, our long-term goal (5 years) is to play in Champions League! Where in Europe you can find a club with such a great opportunity and relatively low cost? Annual budget of Division Two club is $2,000-5,000! In Division One it increases significantly because it is proffesional division - $100, 000 - $300,000.  
     Almaty United is not the first club to be owned and managed by own supporters. For the football management simulators fans it is brilliant opportunity to start with probably lowest league european club - for those fans who loves to challenge hardest tasks and succeed!  
Check these links for more info:
Become an Owner of AUFC: http://www.yourfootballclub.org/www/becomeanowner.htm
AUFC managers: http://www.yourfootballclub.org/www/teammanagers/teammanagers.htm
AUFC Owners: http://www.yourfootballclub.org/www/clubowners.htm
About Kazakstan: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kazakhstan
Read the contract: http://www.yourfootballclub.org/www/aufcprivatecontract.htm
lenders.occupational_info: I am a playing coach and manager of AUFC. My work is to promote AUFC in the world, attract investors, and achieve reasonable results.

lenders.name: Elena
lenders.loan_because:
The members of the San Diego Microfinance Alliance believe in the power of microfinance to alleviate poverty and empower the poor. We know that microfinance creates opportunities to improve lives, not just fleeting fortunes.

We realize we are privileged to live and work in the beautiful city of San Diego, and we feel that compared to much of the world, we have abundant resources. We want to share this wealth with entrepreneurs in developing countries. We host networking events, speakers series and provide a website that serves as an events calendar, jobs board, volunteer database, community forum, and news source.
lenders.occupational_info: I am attorney turned social entrepreneur.  I became a part of the San Diego Microfinance Alliance because I am dedicated to spreading awareness of and enthusiasm for microlending.  I believe a great way to do that is by building a community right here among our own neighbors.  Then we can meet, talk, share ideas, and help each other in our own endeavors and the endeavors of those in developing countries.

lenders.name: Valery
lenders.occupation: ACCION San Diego Business Development Officer
lenders.loan_because: I have experienced first-hand the impact of microlending on the entrepreneur, their family, and the local and global economy.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for a microlending organization in the United States. In my position, I reach out to local private, public and non-profit partners to spread the word about how our loan and business assistance program can help the entrepreneurs they work with on a daily basis. I strive to raise awareness about microfinance locally in order to  increase support for local businesses.

lenders.name: David
lenders.loan_because: I can, and prefer loans to donations
lenders.occupational_info: developing teaching staff in Higher Education
